etymology.description: semantic: 日 (“sun”) + phonetic: 京 (OC *kraŋ). Originally ‘sunlight’.
etymology.interpretation: 日 signals a connection to sunlight and brightness, while 京 provides the pronunciation. The original sense of sunlight broadened to bright views and, by extension, scenery.

examples.chinese: 这里的风景很美(這裡的風景很美)。
清晨的阳光照亮山谷(清晨的陽光照亮山谷)，景色格外明丽(景色格外明麗)。
examples.pinyin: Qīngchén de yángguāng zhàoliàng shāngǔ, jǐngsè géwài mínglì.
examples.english: The morning sunlight lit up the valley, and the view was especially brilliant.

examples.chinese: 假期我们去北京看古都的名胜风景(假期我們去北京看古都的名勝風景)。
examples.pinyin: Jiàqī wǒmen qù Běijīng kàn gǔdū de míngshèng fēngjǐng.
examples.english: During the holiday we went to Beijing to see the famous sights of the ancient capital.
